newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Optus sees 2nd pay TV losses same as 1st half.
newsitem.headline: Optus sees 2nd pay TV losses same as 1st half.

text.p: Optus Communications Pty Ltd chief executive officer Ziggy Switkowski said on Tuesday that losses from its pay television arm, Optus Vision, in the six months to June 30, were about the same level as the first half of 1996/97.
"They are running at about the same level," Switkowski told reporters after giving a speech to the Securities Institute of Australia luncheon.

Optus Vision reported a loss of A$168.2 million in the six months to December 31, 1996. The losses were mainly associated with the A$3.0 billion cost of building its cable network, which also carries telephony services.
